data.title: Geisel School of Medicine
data.text:
Robert A. Weinberg

EDUCATION:

1960-1964 Massachusetts Institute of Technology, Cambridge, MA, S.B., Biology

1964-1965 and 1966-1969 Massachusetts Institute of Technology, Cambridge, MA, Ph.D., Biology

HONORS:

American Cancer Society Massachusetts Division Research Scholar, 1974-1977

Rita Allen Foundation Scholar, 1976-1980

Massachusetts American Cancer Society: National Divisional Award, 1982

Discover Magazine Scientist of the Year, 1982

Warren Triennial Prize, Massachusetts General Hospital, 1983

Robert Koch Medal, Robert Koch Foundation, Germany, 1983

Hammer Cancer Foundation Award, 1984

National Academy of Sciences, U. S. Steel Foundation Award in Molecular Biology, 1984

Bristol-Myers Award for Distinguished Achievement in Cancer Research, 1984

Howard Taylor Ricketts Award, University of Chicago Medical Center, 1984

Brown-Hazen Award, New York State Department of Health, 1984

Ph.D., honoris causa, Northwestern University, Evanston, Illinois, 1984

Antonio Feltrinelli Prize, Academia Nazionale dei Lincei, Rome, 1984

American Cancer Society Professor of Biology, 1985

Member, U.S. National Academy of Sciences, 1985

Katherine Berkan Judd Award, Memorial Sloan-Kettering Cancer Center, 1986

Fellow, American Association for the Advancement of Science, 1987

Sloan Prize, General Motors Cancer Research Foundation, 1987

Ph.D., honoris causa, State University of New York, Stony Brook, 1988

Simon B. Shubitz Award, University of Chicago Medical School, 1989

Fellow, American Academy of Arts and Sciences, 1989

Sc.D., honoris causa, Mount Sinai School of Medicine, City University of New York, 1989

Lucy Wortham James Award, Society for Surgical Oncology, 1989

Distinguished Basic Scientist Award, Milken Family Medical Foundation, 1990

Lila Gruber Cancer Research Award, American Academy of Dermatology, 1990

Christopher Columbus Discovery Award in Biomedical Research, 1992

Foreign Member-Medical Sciences, Royal Swedish Academy of Sciences, 1992

Gairdner Foundation International Awards for Achievements in Medical Science, 1992

Fellow, American Academy of Microbiology, 1992

Harvey Prize, American Society for Technion, Israel Institute of Technology, 1994

William Johnson Walker Prize, Museum of Science, Boston, 1995

Charles Rodolphe Brupbacher Prize, 1995

G.H.A. Clowes Memorial Award, American Association for Cancer Research, 1996

Janssen Prize, Center for Advanced Biotechnology and Medicine, New Jersey, 1996

Max Delbruck Medal of the Max-Delbruck Center, Berlin, 1996

Daniel K. Ludwig Professorship for Cancer Research, 1997

Robert J. and Claire Pasarow Foundation, 1997

National Medal of Science, 1997

Keio Medical Science Foundation Prize, 1997

Elizabeth A. Wood Science Writing Award, American Crystallographic Association, 1999

Killian Faculty Achievement Award, 1999

The City of Medicine Award, 1999

The Order Pour le Mï¿½rite for Sciences and the Arts, 1999

Ernst W. Bertner Memorial Award, MD Anderson Cancer Center, 2000

American Philosophical Society, 2000

Institute of Medicine, 2000

POSITIONS HELD:

1965-1966 Instructor in Biology, Stillman College, Tuscaloosa, AL

1969-1970 Postdoctoral Fellow with Dr. Ernest Winocour, Weizmann Institute, Rehovoth, Israel

1970-1972 Postdoctoral Fellow with Dr. Renato Dulbecco, Salk Institute

1972-1973 Research Associate with Dr. David Baltimore, Massachusetts Institute of Technology

1973-1976 Assistant Professor, Department of Biology and Center for Cancer Research, MIT

1976-1982 Associate Professor, Department of Biology and Center for Cancer Research, MIT

1982-present Professor of Biology, Department of Biology, MIT, Cambridge, MA

1982-present Member, Whitehead Institute for Biomedical Research, Cambridge, MA

ADVISORY BOARDS:

1988-1997t Scientific Advisory Board Member, Institute of Molecular Pathology, Vienna, Austria

1989 Committee on Responsible Conduct of Research, U.S. Institute of Medicine

1989-1991 National Council Member, Federation of American Scientists

1990-present Board of Scientific Advisors, Hoffman-LaRoche, Inc.

1990-present Honorary Director, American Cancer Society, Massachusetts Division

1990-present Scientific and Academic Advisory Committee, Weizmann Institute, Israel

1991-present Awards Assembly Member, General Motors Cancer Research Foundation, Inc.

1991-1995 Research Advisory Board, Massachusetts General Hospital

PROFESSIONAL ACTIVITIES:

Chairman, Institute of Medicine, National Academy of Sciences Panel on Oncogene Research, 1984

Member, Institute of Medical Committee on Science Conduct, 1988-1989

Chairman, M.I.T. Medical Consumers Advisory Committee, 1988-present

Chairman, Federation of American Scientists (F.A.S.) Committee on Biological Warfare, 1989-1991

Organizer/Chairman, UCLA Symposia at Taos, New Mexico, 1989

Organizing Committee, 14th Bristol-Myers Squibb Symposium on Cancer Research Nuclear Process and Oncogenes, 1990

Organizer/Chairman, Preuss Foundation Meeting, Cambridge, MA, 1990

Organizer/Chairman, American Academy of Cancer Research (AACR) Meeting on Negative Controls on Cell Growth and Their Breakdown During the Pathogenesis of Cancer, October, 1991

Chairman, M.I.T. Committee on Indirect Costs and Graduate Student Tuition, 1991-1992

PERSONAL:

Robert Weinberg was born November 11, 1942, in Pittsburgh, PA. He is married to Amy Shulman Weinberg
